channel.title: math.MG updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.MG updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On certain extremal Banach-Mazur distances in small dimensions
item.description: arXiv:2407.08829v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study the maximal possible Banach-Mazur distance for certain pairs of symmetric convex bodies. A classical consequence of the John Ellipsoid Theorem is that the Banach-Mazur distance of a symmetric convex body $K \subseteq \mathbb{R}^n$ to the $n$-dimensional Euclidean ball is not greater than $\sqrt{n}$. Equality holds in every dimension $n$ for the unit balls of $\ell_1^n$ and $\ell_{\infty}^n$, that is, for cross-polytopes and parallelotopes in dimension $n$. While it is known that in dimension $n \geq 4$, there are more convex bodies (not affinely equivalent to either of the previous two) with the distance $\sqrt{n}$ to the ball, and that for $n=2$ the parallelogram is unique, the characterization of the equality case for dimension $n=3$ seems to have never been published. We prove that the three-dimensional cross-polytopes and parallelotopes are the only symmetric convex bodies in $\mathbb{R}^3$ with the distance $\sqrt{3}$ to the Euclidean ball. Moreover, in the planar case we establish the stability of the uniqueness of the parallelogram with the best possible (linear) order of the estimate. We also consider the maximal possible Banach-Mazur distance between planar $1$-symmetric convex bodies. In this case, we prove that the maximal possible distance is $\sqrt{2}$ and characterize the equality case, which again involves a parallelogram.
item.dc:creator: Florian Grundbacher, Tomasz Kobos

item.title: Some classes of minimal surfaces in the $3$-space with $2m$-norm
item.description: arXiv:2407.08896v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We discuss translation minimal surfaces, homothetical minimal surfaces, and separable minimal surfaces in the $3$-space with $2m$-norm.
item.dc:creator: Makoto Sakaki, Ryota Tanaka

item.title: Coarse obstructions to cocompact cubulation
item.description: arXiv:2407.09275v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We provide geometric methods to both lower- and upper-bound the large-scale dimension of CAT(0) cube complexes quasiisometric to a given group $G$. When these bounds overlap, this provides obstructions to $G$ being cocompactly cubulated. More strongly, it prevents $G$ from being a coarse median space. As applications, we show that many free-by-cyclic groups cannot be cocompactly cubulated, and that any tubular group with a coarse median is virtually compact special.
item.dc:creator: Zachary Munro, Harry Petyt

item.title: The Gromov-Wasserstein distance between spheres
item.description: arXiv:2306.10586v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper we consider a two-parameter family {dGWp,q}p,q of Gromov- Wasserstein distances between metric measure spaces. By exploiting a suitable interaction between specific values of the parameters p and q and the metric of the underlying spaces, we determine the exact value of the distance dGW4,2 between all pairs of unit spheres of different dimension endowed with their Euclidean distance and their uniform measure.
item.dc:creator: Shreya Arya, Arnab Auddy, Ranthony Edmonds, Sunhyuk Lim, Facundo Memoli, Daniel Packer
